name: 行動文學：說故事的藝術及其應用
goals: Offer individual perspective with critical thinking in analyzing different works.
Develop practical skills to explore storytelling methodology (point of view, emotional engagement, dramatic action, reading out loud, body language, facial expression, etc.)
Understand the ways to effectively apply storytelling to their daily communication.
Choose appropriate virtual media as a delivery option for story-based presentation.
syllabus: Course description: This is a course combining appreciation of art works and story-telling in the application of guided tours in NTNU neighborhood. Three major components: field trips, workshops, and onsite presentations. Students will learn to produce good images of art works and art maps; to research and acquire techniques in story-telling, and to design/conduct guided walking tours. The three workshops in this course feature exploration of art works inside and outside NTNU campus, as well as practicum in art museum. Invited speakers: —蘇瑤華，台師大美術館執行長 —周逸傑，亞洲版圖創藝有限公司藝術總監、新北市公共藝術教育暨導覽訓練講師 —馬立群，曾任壹週刊數位攝影副理、現任《一影像》創辦人 Invited commentators: —黃蓉，首創城市氣味導覽Smells of Taipei，艋舺文創專業導覽 —Nick Sumares，東海大學外文系講師，曾於師大教授 “Literature in Action” Requirements: 1.Students need to bring their laptops, pads or smart phones for the class. 2.Grading policy: Story-telling presentations 60% Map-making 20% Class discussion & participation 20% 3.If the Covid-pandemic remains severe, classes will be conducted through Webex, with streaming lectures, digital fields trips, and online discussion.
